channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2024040799
item.description:
Report X-2024040799

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-13
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was on load side when discovered wet and a non-regulated damage was done due to this not having no diamond labels on outer carton and then placed in hazmat cage and when I got here pulled a SDS for shipment and this was a undeclared hazmat with no diamond labels on outer carton, one inner can was dented and no clips on inner can, so all the liquid leaked out. DescribePack: Inner can was dented and no clips on inner can so all the liquid leaked out soiling whole shipment and outer carton. DurationRel: 36 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was taken to QA then hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024040733
item.description:
Report X-2024040733

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: COLORADO SPRINGS
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. 4 cans of Aussie Mega Hair Spray 24 Hour Flexible Hold, 14 ounces/ 396g each. 1 can leaked its total contents. 2 of the 4 cans were missing their tops. The outer packaging is a plastic bag-FedEx Pak. All remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024040774
item.description:
Report X-2024040774

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered in the unload. The unload manager called upon an Admin for assistance in containing the shipment. DescribePack: A loose cap/top/plug was the root cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin contained the shipment in a hazardous materials spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.

item.title: Report X-2024040737
item.description:
Report X-2024040737

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-07
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 6th two packages containing UN3082 Environmentally Hazardous Substance, liquid, 9 were discovered by an odor. The packages were not marked or labeled as DG. However an SDS was discovered that classified them as DG. The amounts in each package exceeds the limit of Special Provision A197. The shipment is being held pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024040758
item.description:
Report X-2024040758

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking and brought to a well ventilated QA area away from package handlers. DescribePack: Outer Package was undamaged beside the internal leakage DurationRel: 150 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed upright and this seemed to stop the leaking and the loose caps where later tightened

item.title: Report X-2024040818
item.description:
Report X-2024040818

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Hazmat shipped without papers under wrong service code. Plastic pail shipped without overpack. Shipping label applied over vented cap in pail lid. Liquid leaked through cap vent, damaging label and soiling pail. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024040497
item.description:
Report X-2024040497

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was noticeably wet when it was being unloaded. It was placed in a lined hazmat tote and taken to the designated damaged hazmat area. DescribePack: Upon inspection, it was discovered that 3 of the 4 bottles inside the pkg had loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The caps were tightened.

item.title: Report X-2024040482
item.description:
Report X-2024040482

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-18T18:14:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: BROOMFIELD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This hazmat has a strong odor which was noticed by a manager whom placed hazmat in a plastic bag and tote. The hazmat was stored in QA1. DescribePack: There is a strong odor leaking out of the bottles. I could not find any sign of liquid leaking out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a plastic bag and tote.
